file_content.text: You're all going down to the planet? Who knew Hoth was this popular?
Going to Hoth, Master Jedi?
Heading down to Hoth, Captain?
You want to go to Hoth? Seriously? Today just keeps getting stranger.
Going to the planet surface?
The shuttle is prepped and ready. We're just waiting for clearance from the station controller to launch.
I've never even heard of this planet before. What should I expect?
What's it like down there?
I hope you like ice.
You've got your ice canyons, your ice plains, some ice mountains....
This is a frozen rock on the edge of the galaxy. How much traffic can there be?
What's the holdup?
Shh, don't make him mad. He'll detect an "instrument malfunction" or something, and they'll tie up my shuttle all day.
There was more traffic when we started the salvage operations, but nobody's come back up in a while. The ships are probably frozen to the ground.
Why is the Republic on Hoth?
Salvage operations. There was a huge space battle with the Empire near here, and a whole fleet crashed into Hoth.
Wouldn't want to count how many millions of credits the Republic lost in the ice.
Really, you ought to try to savor this delay. Every minute you're not freezing to death is a good one.
What's valuable enough to justify risking the lives of so many, just battling the elements?
Why is the Republic here?
They don't tell me anything. All I know is, we lost something on this planet, and we're not leaving until we find it.
A little frostbite is good for you. Keeps you on your toes.
It'll build character.
If they don't fall off.
Great. I can scratch, "Freeze to death on a desolate backwater planet," off my to-do list.
Well, it'll be something new.
That's the spirit!
This is starting to sound less and less like a good idea.
Now I'm not sure I want to go.
There's a reason I spend most of my time up here instead of on the planet.
Anything else I should know?
There are worse things on Hoth than the weather. This place is crawling with Imperials and pirates.
Before I forget, you'll need this cold-weather equipment. If you're lucky, you won't use it much.
Everything checks out. You are cleared for launch.
You should check in with the commander at Aurek Base when we land. He'll be able to tell you a lot more about Hoth.
I'm ready when you are. Give the word.
I'm curious to see this ice world now.
Let's go.
Wait a minute, I'm not ready to go yet.
Not just yet.
Come back when you're ready.
The shuttle is ready to launch. Just let me know when you want to go to Hoth.
Let's go. The place isn't getting any warmer.
I'm ready.
I have some things to do first. Wait here.
Not yet.
Just say the word. I'm not going anywhere in the meantime.
